content: Create a table in markdown format listing out ten essential vitamins and minerals, their primary functions in the human body, and one food source for each.

Sure, here's a table that lists ten essential vitamins and minerals, their primary functions in the human body, and a food source for each:

| Vitamin/Mineral | Primary Function | Food Source |
|-----------------|------------------|-------------|
| Vitamin A       | Vision, immune system, cell growth | Carrots |
| Vitamin C       | Collagen production, immune support, antioxidant | Oranges |
| Vitamin D       | Calcium absorption, bone health | Fatty fish (like salmon) |
| Vitamin E       | Antioxidant, protects cells from damage | Almonds |
| Vitamin K       | Blood clotting, bone health | Kale |
| Calcium         | Bone health, muscle function, nerve transmission | Dairy products (like milk) |
| Iron            | Hemoglobin production, oxygen transport | Red meat |
| Magnesium       | Enzyme function, protein synthesis, muscle and nerve function | Spinach |
| Potassium       | Fluid balance, muscle function, nerve transmission | Bananas |
| Zinc            | Immune function, protein synthesis, wound healing | Oysters |

This table provides a brief overview of each nutrient's role and a common food source where it can be found. It's important to have a balanced diet that includes a variety of foods to ensure you're getting all the necessary vitamins and minerals.
